sen.j: 浄弁（じょうべん、生年不詳 - 延文元年/正平 (日本)11年（1356年）頃?）は、鎌倉時代の天台宗の僧・歌人。
sen.e: Joben (date of birth unknown - ca. 1356) was a poet and a Tendai sect's monk who lived in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 尊円法親王の庇護を受け青蓮院別当となった。
sen.e: He became a betto (the superior of a temple) of Shoren-in Temple under the patronage of Cloistered Imperial Prince Sonen.

sen.j: 和歌四天王の一人慶運の父で、浄弁も和歌四天王の一人に数えられる。
sen.e: Known as the father of Unkei, one of The Four Heavenly Kings of Waka, Joben is also counted among the four.

sen.j: 「古今集」証本の書写をはじめ、子の慶運や九州の赤橋英時・大友貞宗らに家説を伝授相伝するなど、二条流歌学の保持に尽くした。
sen.e: He served for maintaining the study of Nijo School's poetry, teaching the family traditions as well as shohon (premised book) of the 'Kokin shu' (abbreviation for Kokin Wakashu (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry)) to his son, Unkei, and those who were from Kyushu District such as Hidetoki AKAHASHI and Sadamune OTOMO.
